\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{BasicPodProtocol:BasicPodProtocol.POD_Basics.GetPODpacket}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{GetPODpacket}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{cmd}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{str\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{p,p}{|}\DUrole{w,w}{  }int}}, \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{payload}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{int\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{p,p}{|}\DUrole{w,w}{  }bytes\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{p,p}{|}\DUrole{w,w}{  }tuple\DUrole{p,p}{{[}}int\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{p,p}{|}\DUrole{w,w}{  }bytes\DUrole{p,p}{{]}}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{p,p}{|}\DUrole{w,w}{  }None}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{o,o}{=}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ bytes}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Builds a POD packet and writes it to a POD device via COM port. If an integer payload is give,         the method will convert it into a bytes string of the length expected by the command. If a bytes         payload is given, it must be the correct length.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cmd}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ | }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Command number.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{payload}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ | }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bytes}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ | }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{tuple}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ | }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bytes}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} None when there is no payload. If there                 is a payload, set to an integer value, bytes string, or tuple. Defaults to None.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Raises}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Exception}} \textendash{} POD command does not exist.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Exception}} \textendash{} POD command requires a payload.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bytes string of the POD packet.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
bytes

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

Reads a complete POD packet, either in standard or binary format, beginning with STX and         ending with ETX. Reads first STX and then starts recursion.

\sphinxAtStartPar

Set to False to                 skip validation. Defaults to True.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bytes string containing a POD packet beginning with STX and ending with ETX. This                 may be a standard packet, binary packet, or an unformatted packet (STX+something+ETX).

\sphinxAtStartPar
Reads the command number. If the command number ends in ETX, the packet is returned.         Next, it checks if the command is allowed. Then, it checks if the command is standard or         binary and reads accordingly, then returns the packet.

\index{\_Read\_Binary() (BasicPodProtocol.POD\_Basics method)@\spxentry{\_Read\_Binary()}\spxextra{BasicPodProtocol.POD\_Basics method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{BasicPodProtocol:BasicPodProtocol.POD_Basics._Read_Binary}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_Read\_Binary}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{prePacket}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{bytes}}, \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{validateChecksum}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{bool}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{o,o}{=}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{True}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ bytes}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Reads the remaining part of the variable\sphinxhyphen{}length binary packet. It first reads the standard         packet (prePacket+payload+checksum+ETX). Then it determines how long the binary packet is from the         payload of the standard POD packet and reads that many bytes. It then reads to ETX to get the         checksum+ETX.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{prePacket}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bytes}}) \textendash{} Bytes string containing the beginning of a POD packet: STX (1 byte)                 + command number (4 bytes)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{validateChecksum}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Set to True to validate the checksum. Set to False to                 skip validation. Defaults to True.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Raises}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Exception}} \textendash{} An exception is raised if the checksum is invalid (only if validateChecksum=True).

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bytes string for a variable\sphinxhyphen{}length binary POD packet.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
bytes

\end{description}\end{quote}

Reads one byte at a time up to 4 bytes to get the ASCII\sphinxhyphen{}encoded bytes command number. For each         byte read, it can (1) start the recursion over if an STX is found, (2) returns if ETX is found, or         (3) continue building the command number.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Class\sphinxhyphen{}level integer representing the minimum length of a binary POD     command packet. Format is STX (1 byte) + command number (4 bytes) + length     of binary (4 bytes) + checksum (2 bytes) + ETX (1 bytes) + binary (LENGTH     bytes) + checksum (2 bytes) + ETX (1 bytes)

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Overwrites the parent’s method. Unpacks the binary4 POD packet and converts the values of the         ASCII\sphinxhyphen{}encoded bytes into integer values and the values of binary\sphinxhyphen{}encoded bytes into integers.         Channel values are given in Volts.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{msg}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bytes}}) \textendash{} Bytes string containing a complete binary4 Pod packet:  STX (1 byte)                 + command (4 bytes) + packet number (1 bytes) + TTL (1 byte) + ch0 (2 bytes)                 + ch1 (2 bytes) + ch2 (2 bytes) + checksum (2 bytes) + ETX (1 byte).

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A dictionary containing ‘Command Number’, ‘Packet \#’,             ‘TTL’, ‘Ch0’, ‘Ch1’, and ‘Ch2’ as numbers.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
dict{[}str,int|float|dict{[}str,int{]}{]}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

Overwrites the parent’s method. Unpacks the binary5 POD packet and converts the values of the         ASCII\sphinxhyphen{}encoded bytes into integer values and the values of binary\sphinxhyphen{}encoded bytes into integers. The         channels and analogs are converted to volts (V).

\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{msg}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bytes}}) \textendash{} Bytes string containing a complete binary 5 Pod packet: STX (1 byte)                 + command (4) + packet number (1) + status (1) + channels (9) + analog inputs (12)                 + checksum (2) + ETX (1).

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A dictionary containing ‘Command Number’, ‘Packet \#’, ‘Status’,                 ‘D’, ‘C’, ‘B’, ‘A’, ‘Analog EXT0’,  ‘Analog EXT1’, ‘Analog TTL1’, ‘Analog TTL2’,                 ‘Analog TTL3’, ‘Analog TTL4’, as numbers.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
dict{[}str,int|dict{[}str,int{]}{]}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Converts a ASCII\sphinxhyphen{}encoded bytes message into an integer.  It does this using a base\sphinxhyphen{}16         conversion. If the message is signed and the msb is ‘1’, the integer will be converted to         it’s negative 2’s complement.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{msg\_b}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bytes}}) \textendash{} Bytes message to be converted to an integer. The bytes must be base\sphinxhyphen{}16 or                 the conversion will fail.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{signed}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} True if the message is signed, false if unsigned. Defaults to False.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Integer result from the ASCII\sphinxhyphen{}encoded byte conversion.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
int

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{static\DUrole{w,w}{  }}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{BuildPODpacket\_Standard}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{commandNumber}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{int}}, \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{payload}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{bytes\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{p,p}{|}\DUrole{w,w}{  }None}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{o,o}{=}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ bytes}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Builds a standard POD packet as bytes: STX (1 byte) + command number (4 bytes)         + optional packet (? bytes) + checksum (2 bytes)+ ETX (1 bytes).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{commandNumber}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Integer representing the command number. This will be converted into                 a 4 byte long ASCII\sphinxhyphen{}encoded bytes string.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

Defaults to None.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar
bytes

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{Checksum() (PodPacketHandling.POD\_Packets static method)@\spxentry{Checksum()}\spxextra{PodPacketHandling.POD\_Packets static method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{PodPacketHandling:PodPacketHandling.POD_Packets.Checksum}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{static\DUrole{w,w}{  }}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Checksum}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{bytesIn}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{bytes}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ bytes}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculates the checksum of a given bytes message. This is achieved by summing each byte in the         message, inverting, and taking the last byte.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{bytesIn}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bytes}}) \textendash{} Bytes message containing POD packet data.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
bytes

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{IntToAsciiBytes() (PodPacketHandling.POD\_Packets static method)@\spxentry{IntToAsciiBytes()}\spxextra{PodPacketHandling.POD\_Packets static method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{PodPacketHandling:PodPacketHandling.POD_Packets.IntToAsciiBytes}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{static\DUrole{w,w}{  }}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{IntToAsciiBytes}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{value}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{int}}, \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n,n}{numChars}\DUrole{p,p}{:}\DUrole{w,w}{  }\DUrole{n,n}{int}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ bytes}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Converts an integer value into ASCII\sphinxhyphen{}encoded bytes.

\sphinxAtStartPar
First, it converts the integer value into a usable uppercase hexadecimal string. Then it converts         the ASCII code for each character into bytes. Lastly, it ensures that the final message is the         desired length.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Example: if value=2 and numBytes=4, the returned ASCII will show b’0002’, which is         ‘0x30 0x30 0x30 0x32’ in bytes. Uses the 2’s complement if the val is negative.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{value}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Integer value to be converted into ASCII\sphinxhyphen{}encoded bytes.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{numChars}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Number characters to be the length of the ASCII\sphinxhyphen{}encoded message.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bytes that are ASCII\sphinxhyphen{}encoded conversions of the value parameter.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
bytes

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Setup\_PodDevices allows a user to set up and stream from any number of POD devices. The streamed     data is saved to a file.

\sphinxAtStartPar
REQUIRES FIRMWARE 1.0.2 OR HIGHER.
